intro: Tragopyrum aucheri, commonly known as the Armenian goatherb, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and early spring bloom.
